meanings.definition: A cultural movement or phenomenon that opposes or seeks to challenge mainstream societal norms and values.
meanings.sent1: The counterculturalism of the 1960s challenged traditional values and norms.
meanings.sent2: Counterculturalism often involves questioning authority and societal expectations.
meanings.sent3: The counterculturalism of the group led to some interesting debates at the community center.
meanings.sent4: Her counterculturalism was like a bright light shining in a sea of conformity.
meanings.sent5: The counterculturalism of the youth movement was both inspiring and controversial.

meanings.definition: The beliefs, practices, and attitudes associated with countercultural movements.
meanings.sent1: Their counterculturalism included unconventional fashion choices and alternative lifestyles.
meanings.sent2: Counterculturalism can be seen in the music, art, and literature of the era.
meanings.sent3: The counterculturalism of the group made them stand out in the small town.
meanings.sent4: In a world of conformity, her counterculturalism was a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The counterculturalism of the community was a source of both admiration and controversy.
